intro: Dryadodaphne novoguineensis var. macra, commonly known as the Macra dryadodaphne, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has elliptical leaves that are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
